p: The Apiaceae family, formerly called Umbelliferae, includes food plants (carrots, fennels, etc.) and condiments (caraway, coriander, etc.) [ 2]. Several species of this family are considered to be a rich source of essential and vegetable oils that can be exploited in the pharmaceutical, cosmetic, perfume and food industries [ 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]. The vegetable oil contained in the umbelliferous seeds, which is very rich in petroselinic acid, is localized in the oleosomes. Petroselinic acid (C18:1n12) is a rare monounsaturated fatty acid and isomer of oleic acid which is used as a valuable raw material in the chemical industries [ 7, 8].
